page.title: 05Lawhitton area, Cornwall
page.content: west bank of Tamar, gently rolling hills, wooded in parts, lush hedgerows, fertile valley. Land used for general farming, semi-instensive grassland for cattle and sheep. Single track road leads to Wishworthy Farm, with dairy herd, biazantic a Methodist chapel now converted to a dwelling house. There is a small stone quarry, little used, giving hard core and walling. A tiny hamlet named Lewcombe on the map known locally as Luccombe. There are 2 adjoining cottages occupied by a mother and son. The old lady, nearly blind, has lived all her life at Luccombe. Her widowed son is a plumber. the remianing land is farmed by Lawhitton Barton as far south as Greystone Bridge. A large mixed farm with four workmens' houses each with fruit, flower and vegetable gardens.
